page.title: 10ENGLISH STRING ORCHESTRA
page.content: The {English String Orchestra}, formally the{Vivaldi Chamber Ensemble} , was formed when the BBC announced the disbanding of five orchestras including the{Midland Radio Orchestra. The orchestra consists of{21}regular musicians :- 13 violins,3 violas, 3 cellos,2 basses and a harpsicord. The orchestra's sponsers include {Mitsubishi Electric}and{ESSO Petrol. Future engagements include the{Three {Choirs Festival,Berlin Festival}and tours in{America}and{Canada.} Remuneration for a musician is Â£37 per concert, the annual budget is now Â£150,000 , audiences averaging{450.} The orchestra rehearses for two days before a series of concerts.Each musician practises for 2 hours a day. In{1987}the E.S.O. plans to make its "home"the{Countess of Huntingdonshire {Chapel,in the city of Worcester.}
